title: Cheeky 'hoverboard' owners test the UK ban by riding theirs in front of police
text: 13:56   Google+ Isn't it supposed to be illegal to ride these so-called "hoverboards" in public? Maybe somebody forgot to tell the police about the new legislation , because the results of a recent social experiment suggest they are oblivious.YouTube channel Carnage put the ban to the test by riding their self-balancing scooters in front of British police officers.Not only do the coppers seem indifferent about the minor offence taking place under their noses, one of them even joins in with the hijinx and has a go on the Segway herself.Providing this was actually a social experiment and not some staged prank, it's safe to assume you won't be hauled off to prison for violating this law.The video hit the web just days after the Met Police tweeted a warning to confirm the illegal status of hoverboards.
